page.title: 10Lydiard Tregoze Church
page.content: Of the churches in the area{St.Mary's {Lydiard Tregoze}is the most memorable. Dating mostly from the 13th and 15th centuries the{St.John}family added many unusual features. There are monuments to the family including a figure called the{"Golden Cavalier" of Edward St.John who died at the battle of{Newbury}in{1645.} In the sanctuary hangs the unique {St,John Triptych,}a large folding painting showing members of the family in their 17th century costume, the restoration of this painting having been completed this year. {Mediaeval wall paintings}are visible in some parts of the church and 3 helmets hang on the chapel walls. The general colourful decoration of the church interior has largely survived due to its isolation, Tregoze village having long since vanished .
